entry.title: Liebfrauenkirche (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Liebfrauenkirche (pictured), a Catholic church in Zurich, was designed with Italian influences to distinguish it from churches of other denominations?

entry.title: a Stegosaurus fossil (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Stegosaurus fossil sold for $44.6 million?

entry.title: the fourth poem of a quintet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to Charles Melville, poet Hatefi implied that Timur was another Alexander the Great by making Timur the subject of the fourth poem of a quintet?

entry.title: photographs of Donald Trump (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that photographs of Donald Trump taken during the failed attempt to assassinate him have been acclaimed as "immediately legendary"?

entry.title: Jerzy Artysz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jerzy Artysz was given a gala concert on his 70th birthday by the Chopin University of Music?

entry.title: Costello's (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ernest Hemingway broke a cane over John O'Hara's head in Costello's, an Irish bar in New York City?

entry.title: Huang Wenxiu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after her 2019 death in rural China, Huang Wenxiu was elevated into a national model by the Chinese Communist Party?

entry.title: Pontic Greek culture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that traditional folk dances are an essential part of Pontic Greek culture?

entry.title: r/nosleep (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that police were called several times in 2014 about a fictitious post on r/nosleep?
